body_html:
Let's get this change in and we can fix it afterwards.

On Fri, Nov 18, 2016 at 1:14 PM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

Hi @jihunchoi https://github.com/jihunchoi , thanks for pointing this
out!

Yes, it's because that tf.convert_to_tensor changes the RNNCell to a
tensor. I assume the reason why we use tf.convert_to_tensor was because
the user might supply a numpy matrix instead? (@ebrevdo
https://github.com/ebrevdo?)

I thought about your solution as well, but I found it overengineering the
data structures from the RNNCell. Instead I removed the
tf.convert_to_tensor. Your code should run just fine now.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#4686 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimzc-t1kjhoSHC_J1-05YloDrLDmdks5q_hUsgaJpZM4KLMiD
.

> Hi @jihunchoi https://github.com/jihunchoi , thanks for pointing this
> out!
> 
> Yes, it's because that tf.convert_to_tensor changes the RNNCell to a
> tensor. I assume the reason why we use tf.convert_to_tensor was because
> the user might supply a numpy matrix instead? (@ebrevdo

> 
> I thought about your solution as well, but I found it overengineering the
> data structures from the RNNCell. Instead I removed the
> tf.convert_to_tensor. Your code should run just fine now.
